Pore/Structural Features.Pore Size: 0.4 nm, 0.75 nm (for ZIF-8); shifts toward 0.5 nm for ZIF-90

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Gate-opening effect at low nitrogen activity and constriction of micropores at higher nitrogen activity

Other Information.Additional Info: Two inflection points observed in physisorption isotherms.

Sieving Mechanism: Gate-opening mechanism allowing rotational displacement of linkers

Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Micropore volume reduction with increasing OHC-IM loading; BET and Langmuir surface area measurements provided in Supporting Information.

Other Information.Additional Info: Thermal stability decreases with higher OHC-IM loadings; Bz-IM not present in this hybrid system.

Pore/Structural Features.Pore Size: Shifts to smaller values, ~0.32 nm appears at 20% Bz-IM

Topology: R3̅ space group above 35% Bz-IM loading

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Bz-IM groups block rotational displacement of imidazole linkers

Other Information.Additional Info: Progressive suppression of gate-opening phenomena observed.

Sieving Mechanism: Reduction of average pore size by inclusion of bulky Bz-IM linkers

Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: 40% micropore volume reduction from pure ZIF-8 at only 20% Bz-IM loading.

Other Information.Additional Info: Thermal stability increases with higher Bz-IM loadings; OHC-IM not present in this hybrid system.
